main event: On August 25, 1951, two witnesses observed a large, unconventional aircraft over Albuquerque, New Mexico, at approximately 2155 hours.
interesting points: The object was described as having a chevron shape and was estimated to be 1.5 to 2 times the wingspan of a B-36 bomber., It was reported to be traveling at a speed of approximately 300 to 400 mph with no audible sound., The aircraft had glowing white lights on the trailing edge of its wings arranged in pairs., Witnesses claimed the object had black stripes and a concave underside., The sighting was confirmed by the wife of the security guard who observed the craft.
witness description: a security guard and his wife
